abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo points to urgent need for overhaul of state's education system, in his State of the State address, asserting that student test scores show below-average proficiency in skills necessary for higher education; critics argue, however, that Cuomo is overstating crisis, and that using test scores as measure is misleading.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo says New York’s education system “needs dramatic reform.” How bad is New York, really? Relative to others states, experts say, not that bad. But not that good, either.
snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo says New York’s education system “needs dramatic reform.” How bad is New York, really? Relative to others states, experts say, not that bad. But not that good, either.

headline.main: Cuomo Cites School Crisis in New York; Data Suggest Otherwise
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Cites School Crisis; Data Suggest Otherwise
